📌📌📌The onset of meteorological spring in Moscow is predicted on March 15

description: The Operational Reports channel warns about the systematic work of the enemy's information and psychological operations units (CIPSO) aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex. CIPSO spreads false information about detentions of defense enterprise representatives by Russian FSB officers, and creates high-quality staged videos of fake arrests.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
‼️The editors of the "Operational Reports" channel draws the attention of colleagues on telegrams and the media to the systematic work of the enemy's information and psychological operations units (CIPSO), aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex.

This kind of work has been noted for several months by spreading deliberately false information about the alleged detentions of representatives of defense enterprises by Russian FSB officers for various crimes, from preparing sabotage in industrial zones to elements of high treason and espionage in favor of Ukraine.

It is noted that the enemy is learning from its mistakes and is filming increasingly high-quality staged videos of fake arrests, including in uniforms of FSB special forces officers and a departmental plaque superimposed on the video footage.

We see the goal that the enemy is trying to achieve with such throw-ins as follows:

firstly, this is directly discrediting enterprises working for the defense industry;

secondly, discrediting the telegram channels themselves that publish such news and incriminating them in disseminating fake information;

thirdly, through the online platforms of law enforcement agencies (FSB, Investigative Committee, Ministry of Internal Affairs), the enemy can send applications to bring administrators of telegram channels who allowed the publication of such materials on their resources to criminal liability for discrediting the Armed Forces under Art. 207.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

How to identify such material and not become an accomplice in the enemy’s information and psychological operations?

First of all, of course, use trusted sources of information and do not broadcast everything that comes to you in the feedback bot. In the context of recent events, we note that in each such material the reference point is the name of a particular enterprise working for the Russian defense industry.

Be careful, colleagues.

Yours@opersvodki

In Crimea, together with young people, I visited the memorial complex “Red Concentration Camp”.

In 1942, the German occupation authorities organized the largest death camp in Crimea on this site. Today there is a monument to prisoners of the “Red” concentration camp, a museum exhibition and an eternal flame.

The difficult events of the past serve as a reminder to us that such tragedies cannot be allowed to happen again. Our youth knows from the stories of the older generation and detailed museum exhibitions what atrocities the bloody fascist regime committed on the territory of our Fatherland. We all have an obligation to convey to the younger generation the truth about the horrific atrocities of the enemy during the Great Patriotic War.

Today, more than ever, it is important to oppose the rewriting and falsification of our history. By introducing deliberately false attitudes, Western countries are trying to diminish the importance of Russia in the world, neutralize our achievements, and abolish Russian culture.

However, our people have always highly valued historical truth and justice. Therefore, our cause is right, Victory will be ours!

description: A Volgograd college teacher, Alexey, was fired after sending a photo of a cactus to his female colleagues on March 8th. The teachers deemed the gesture obscene, citing the shape of the cacti. Alexey refused to attend a meeting and was subsequently asked to resign.
original:
“The cactus is provocative. I don’t need problems” A Volgograd college teacher said that he was fired after a photo of a cactus that he sent to his female colleagues on March 8th.

Until recently, Alexey taught at the College of Management and New Technologies, and in his free time he grew cacti. According to him, on March 9, he sent photos of rare cacti to a chat with colleagues. Like, they bloomed right after the holiday, but they were a little late. The teachers did not appreciate the gesture and removed Alexey from the chat.

The next day, according to the man, the head of the department called him and invited him to talk. It turned out that the shapes of some cacti confused the ladies, and Alexei’s behavior was considered obscene. The cactus expert refused to come to the conversation and then he was asked to write a statement of his own free will.

Outraged, Alexey published a correspondence on social networks, as he claims, with a college employee, who called the cactus provocative and asked Alexey to calm down. According to Baza, the man was indeed fired from the educational institution. After the story about the dismissal, a petition appeared on social networks demanding Alexey’s reinstatement. It was signed by 64 people.

description: The Zubilo unmanned armored car, designed to support attack aircraft, will undergo testing in April at several Russian military units. The vehicle has been modified to reduce weight and increase maneuverability. It can be equipped with various weapons and used for evacuating the wounded or as a suicidal attack vehicle.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
“Chisel” will be in April: Russian attack aircraft were promised an unmanned armored car. An unmanned armored car in direct support of attack aircraft will soon go to the front. This was reported by the press service of the manufacturing company - JSC Remdizel.

“Testing of the Zubilo unmanned platform will begin in several military units of the Russian Armed Forces in April. The vehicle was modified based on the customer’s wishes. In particular, its weight was reduced and maneuverability was increased,” said representatives of the enterprise.

“Chisel” was first shown at the Army-2023 military-technical forum. The armored car is assembled on the chassis of a serial Kamaz and was originally intended to support assault units.

The remote-controlled combat module "Zubila" can be equipped with various weapons.

It will be possible to use the car to evacuate the wounded. Since the armored car has no crew, in some situations it can be sent on a suicidal attack or used to cover an assault group from enemy fire.

description: Tucker Carlson praised Moscow, stating it's better than any American city. He noted the city's cleanliness, lack of homelessness and graffiti, and impressive architecture. He drew comparisons to US cities of his youth, which were also safe and clean, and expressed disdain for current US leaders.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
Tucker Carlson - on the contrast between Moscow and US cities: [You come to Moscow and say that this is the best place you have ever been in your life. This city is better than anywhere in America]. This is true. Much better. [Why is it better there?] I can only tell you what I saw. And this is a city with a population of 13 million people, more than any of our cities. It's hard to govern a city like this. And there are no homeless people here. No graffiti. Everything is spotlessly clean. The public areas are wonderful. Architecture is not corrupted by postmodernity, the oppression of postmodern architecture, which is designed to demoralize and wound you and destroy your spirit. I'm not going to move to Moscow. I am in America. I'll never leave. But Moscow is not so different from the US cities of my youth. We had a free society, much freer than today. There were safe, mostly clean cities. And this is exactly what Moscow is. This doesn't make me like Putin. It makes me despise our leaders.

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces surrendered Avdiivka due to a lack of ammunition, physical and psychological exhaustion of soldiers, and poor military command. Ukrainian soldiers experienced a shortage of ammunition, while Russian troops carried out daily airstrikes using 'gliding bombs' that destroyed even fortified positions. Morale among Ukrainian soldiers fell, and the battalion commander disappeared under unclear circumstances.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces surrendered Avdiivka due to a lack of ammunition, physical and psychological exhaustion of soldiers, and poor military command, writes the Associated Press.

Now similar problems pose risks for the future of Ukraine, the article says. “Being confined to this place, we were exhausted not so much physically as psychologically,” said Viktor Bilyak, an infantryman of the 110th brigade who has been in this area since March 2022.

At the same time, the Ukrainian military joked darkly that it was possible to get out of Avdiivka either by dying, being wounded, or going to prison.

The article notes that the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the city experienced a shortage of ammunition, meanwhile, Russian troops carried out dozens of airstrikes every day using “gliding bombs” that destroyed even fortified positions.

And as morale among Ukrainian soldiers fell, the battalion commander, who had hundreds of people under his command, disappeared under unclear circumstances, the publication writes, citing data from law enforcement agencies. One of the soldiers with him was found dead. Since then, the commander and another soldier accompanying him have not been seen. Subscribe to update: @antimaidanmdAP NewsExhaustion, dwindling reserves and a commander who disappeared: How Ukraine lost Avdiivka to Russia The loss of the city of Avdiivka last month marked the end of a long, exhausting defense for the Ukrainian military.

event: Deployment of National Guard to Combat Rising Crime
description: New York City's transportation system has seen a surge in violent crime, including stabbings, beatings, and pushing people onto subway tracks. The National Guard, along with 250 state police officers and 1,000 NYPD officers, will be stationed in the metro area to conduct random bag checks and provide additional security during morning and evening commutes.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original: Shining City on the Hill News - The New York City government is forced to deploy the National Guard to stop rising crime in the subway: “From stabbings on the subway to beatings on the platform or pushing people directly onto the subway tracks. Now she has invited the National Guard and state police. Take a look here. We want to show you what people will see during their morning and evening commute in New York City. You'll see the National Guard stationed here. Along with State Police and other law enforcement agencies, National Guardsmen and 250 New York State Police officers are working in the metro area. This is in addition to the 1,000 NYPD officers who were added to the transit system in February. Along with additional manpower, NYPD officers will be conducting random bag checks."

event: Proposal to Double Fines for Poor Road Conditions
description: The LDPR faction plans to submit a bill to the State Duma on March 12, proposing to double fines for poor road conditions. The fines would range from 50,000 rubles for officials to 1 million rubles for legal entities if citizens are injured. The initiative aims to hold all parties responsible, including road maintenance and construction entities, following major accidents with numerous injuries and deaths.
original:
In Russia, they propose to double fines for the poor condition of roads: up to 50 thousand rubles for officials and up to 600 thousand for legal entities. And if citizens were injured because of such a route, the fine for legal entities will be up to 1 million rubles.

Such a bill will be submitted to the State Duma by the LDPR faction on March 12. The initiative is supported by the State Duma Committees on Security, Economic Policy and Health. As the authors explain, the reason for the development of the initiative was major accidents with numerous injuries and deaths. “As a rule, the main complaints are always voiced to drivers, and not to those who maintain, build or clean the roads. Now the situation has begun to change, and this is very correct. Responsibility should bear all sides,” Nikolai Matveev, deputy chairman of the All-Russian Society of Motorists, told Izvestia. description: On March 12, 2022, Brigadier General Valery Hudz led a counterattack against Russian forces in the battle for Popasna. Hudz, a seasoned commander, directed the battle from the front lines, ensuring effective interaction between units. Although the counterattack was successful, Hudz was mortally wounded by a Russian tank shell and died a hero's death.
original:
Exactly two years ago, on March 12, 2022, in the battle for the city of Popasna, one of the real Ukrainian combat commanders - Brigadier General of the 24th Mechanized Brigade Valery Hudz - died a hero's death. He just received an order to be assigned to his native brigade, returned to it, and immediately faced a difficult situation - the enemy stormed the suburbs of Popasnoi with significantly superior forces, tried to gain a foothold in the built-up area, the Russians could only be knocked out by quick counterattacks. Gudz immediately created an assault squad from units of the 24th and 79th amphibious assault brigades. And Colonel Hudz himself prepared and led the counterattack.

There were no Starlinks or Maviks yet, and Hudz decided to direct the battle directly from the order of battle, to see the situation with his own eyes and to give the fighters only such tasks as they were capable of performing, to immediately react to changes in maneuverable combat, so that the interaction worked in attack, and not somewhere in the headquarters on paper.

Gudz has always acted this way - and he started the war in 2014 as a platoon commander, and he had several Russian soldiers on his personal account since 2014, and he repeatedly engaged in close combat.
A quick and decisive counterattack pushed the Russians back from Popasnoi, and the situation was restored for a while. But at the very end of the battle, Valery Hudz was mortally wounded by a shell from a Russian tank. He died leading the attack as a true Ukrainian hero who was a role model and father to all his subordinates and enjoyed absolute authority and respect in the army.

An outstanding warrior, a real Ukrainian hero, who did everything possible for Ukraine and our victory. Eternal memory.

description: The Russian Navy, Chinese Navy, and Iranian Navy are conducting the international naval exercise 'Maritime Security Belt-2024' in the Gulf of Oman. The exercise aims to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities, with over 20 ships, support vessels, and combat boats participating. The exercise involves joint maneuvers, firing at surface and air targets, and practicing elements of freeing a ship captured by pirates.
original:
🇷🇺🇨🇳🇮🇷Ships of the Russian Navy, Chinese and Iranian Navy began to carry out the tasks of the international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt-2024” in the Gulf of Oman. A detachment of warships of the Pacific Fleet consisting of the guards missile cruiser “Varyag” and the frigate “Marshal Shaposhnikov” "has begun to practice the practical tasks of the joint international naval exercise "Maritime Security Belt-2024" with ships of the Iranian and Chinese navies. The exercise is taking place in the waters of the Gulf of Oman in the Arabian Sea. Its main goal is to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities. During the exercise, combat ships of the three countries will perform joint maneuvers and fire at surface and air targets, and will also practice elements of freeing a ship captured by pirates.

In total, more than 20 ships, support vessels and combat boats of the Russian Navy, the Iranian and Chinese Navy are involved in the exercise. Naval helicopters are also widely used.

The international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt 2024” is being held for the sixth time. It was first held in the Arabian Sea in 2018. Ships of the Russian Navy, Iranian and Chinese Navy are participating in the exercise on an ongoing basis. Last year, the frigate Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Gorshkov, the world’s first full-time carrier of hypersonic missile weapons, was involved in the exercise.

For the first time, representatives of the navies of Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Oman, India and South Africa will take part in the exercise as observers.

event: CIA Director's Warning on Ukraine-Russia Negotiations
description: CIA Director Robert Burns warned that without additional US military assistance, Ukraine may be forced to negotiate with Russia on Moscow's terms within a year. Burns believes that Russia's President Vladimir Putin aims to dictate terms in such negotiations.
original:
Without additional military assistance from the United States, Ukraine will be forced to enter into peace negotiations with Russia on Moscow’s terms within a year.

This opinion was expressed by CIA Director Robert Burns at a hearing in the Intelligence Committee of the US House of Representatives.

“He (Vladimir Putin) is interested in such negotiations where he can dictate terms. I think that without additional help, this is the future that can await Ukraine in a year from now,” he said.

According to Burns, the absence of new military assistance will lead to an even greater retreat of the Ukrainian Armed Forces and losses of settlements occupied by Ukrainian troops this year. description: A 42-year-old man from Buinaksk, Dagestan, attempted to attack a resident of Altufyevo, but escaped before the police arrived. He got stuck in an elevator and, when confronted by police, charged at them with a knife. A warning shot was fired, which ricocheted and hit him in the back. He was hospitalized.
original:
The man tried to attack a resident of Altufyevo, managed to escape before the police arrived, but got stuck in the elevator. When they opened him, he rushed at the police with a knife and calmed down only after a warning shot. The bullet ricocheted into his back.

The police were called by a resident of a house on Altufevskoye Highway. He said that at about 3 a.m. an unknown person with a knife started knocking on the neighbors’ door. The stranger shouted about some kind of non-existent debt, made threats and left before the operatives appeared.

After hearing the story, the police went down a couple of floors and met an elevator operator tinkering with a stuck elevator. When the doors opened, the same stranger stood inside. The man was holding a knife. The unknown man did not respond to the police’s demands to drop his weapon; he walked towards the operatives, after which one of the officers fired a warning shot from a Makarov pistol.

Unfortunately for the stranger, the bullet ricocheted off the ceiling and hit him in the shoulder blade. According to “Baza”, the injured attacker turned out to be a 42-year-old resident of the Dagestan Buinaksk, he was hospitalized.

description: The Chelyabinsk region announced the celebration of 'International Maslenitsa', sparking controversy. Critics argue that this move demonstrates a lack of understanding of Russian cultural, historical, and spiritual values, and is an attempt to erase national traditions.
original:
Forwarded from: Kirill Kabanov
The announcement of the celebration of “INTERNATIONAL Maslenitsa” (not just anywhere, but in the Chelyabinsk region) demonstrates the complete lack of understanding among people preparing and making such decisions of what true cultural, historical and spiritual values are. And this misunderstanding is more than complemented by the irresponsibility and complete ignorance of the basics of history, traditions and theology of these officials. I wonder who and most importantly why came up with this dangerous idea? Why this unnecessary epithet anyway?

Maslenitsa is a centuries-old Russian holiday, later adopted by Orthodoxy (Cheese Week), which, as a historical tradition, was preserved even in godless Soviet times. Because it is an ingrained integral part of our distinctive national culture, traditions and history - from Perun to Christianity.

Why this stupidity, which in its approach is very similar to following trends in gender neutrality or abandoning the correct name for Christmas (Xmas instead of Christmas) and its traditional attributes in Western (originally Christian) countries?

Everyone finally needs to accept the indisputable fact that we live in a country where almost 80% of the population is Russian and almost 70% perceive themselves as Orthodox. And we also have our own traditions, of which quite a few have accumulated over the long history of our people. The Russian people have the full constitutional right (!!!) to exclusively their own traditions, holidays, faith and history. We will be happy to tell about them to those who are interested in learning about them. Well, those who are planning to change these traditions for the sake of an incomprehensible agenda can also try to schedule, for example, the celebration of “interethnic Passover.” It's stupid, isn't it?

In our Great Russian World, in which we live today, Maslenitsa will and must remain Russian, just as the Muslim Eid al-Fitr or the Jewish Pesach will remain. This is the preservation of the diversity of our TRADITIONAL HISTORICAL and SPIRITUAL VALUES, in case someone doesn’t know. Telegram Andrey Medvedev The fact that it was the Chelyabinsk region that decided to organize a multinational Maslenitsa is somehow not surprising.
Considering the weight and influence of diasporas in the region, p...VIEW MESSAGE

description: The Security Service of Ukraine carried out searches and arrested suspects in Kyiv, seizing mobile phones and computer equipment used in cyber attacks to destabilize Ukraine and discredit it internationally. The suspects, part of a criminal organization, were notified of suspicion under various articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine, including treason, collaborative activity, and incitement of religious enmity. They face life imprisonment.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
Continuation of the news⬇️By carrying out computer attacks, the enemy hoped not only to destabilize the socio-political situation in Ukraine, but also to discredit our state in the international arena, especially in front of Western partners.

During searches of the places of stay of the persons involved in Kyiv, mobile phones and computer equipment were found, which were used in criminal actions for the benefit of the aggressor country.

Based on the collected evidence, the four detainees and ten other members of the criminal organization were notified of suspicion under the following articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: 2 Art. 111 (treason committed under martial law); 6 Art. 111-1 (collaborative activity); ▪️⁠ ⁠ch. 4 Art. 28, part 1, part 2 of Art. 255 (creation and participation in a criminal organization); 3 Art. 161 (incitement of religious enmity and hatred committed by an organized group); 1, 2 436-2 (justification, recognition as legitimate, denial of armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine).

Currently, the issue of choosing a preventive measure for them - detention in custody is being resolved. An investigation is ongoing to establish all the circumstances of the crime and bring the perpetrators to justice.

Perpetrators face life imprisonment.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the city of Kyiv and Kyiv region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

event: WhatsApp Vulnerabilities and US Intelligence Access
description: WhatsApp messenger has been found to have critical vulnerabilities, including CVE-2022-36934 and CVE-2022-27492, which can be exploited to gain access to user accounts. Additionally, US intelligence agencies, such as the DEA, FBI, NSA, and CIA, have been known to request and access user data from Facebook-owned WhatsApp.
original:
Forwarded from: Afrika Korps
Why shouldn't you use WhatsApp messenger?

This post will highlight some prominent cases of vulnerabilities in the messenger, as well as the ability of US intelligence agencies to access user data. In November 2021, DEA investigators asked Facebook-owned WhatsApp to track seven users from China and Macau. Facebook, of course, took the lead. This is what the TG channel T.Hunter writes about the capabilities of US intelligence services to spy on certain citizens (photo 1) in the WhatsApp messenger. If the US intelligence services are of interest due to their activities, this request may be sent to your soul.

Next, you can read about the critical vulnerabilities of the messenger that could be used to gain access to your account: 1) CVE-2022-36934 (critical vulnerability in WhatsApp) - allowed RCE to be performed via a buffer overflow DURING A VIDEO CALL;

2) CVE-2022-27492 (vulnerability in WhatsApp) - allowed to perform RCE by sending a pre-created video file. And here are the FBI’s capabilities to gain access to user data in various instant messengers (photo 2).

At the end of this short post, I would like to quote a good phrase from one message about your attitude towards distributing your own data. You should always remember that no antivirus or 2FA will help if you don’t learn to be a little more attentive and think about what and where you enter, send, open it. Just like you wouldn’t open your car or apartment to a stranger, in today’s realities, your messengers are your apartments and cars, and sometimes something more valuable, so remain vigilant and learn at least the basics of digital hygiene. Remember that yours depends on you information security, therefore we kindly ask you to refrain from using the WhatsApp messenger, which, with a click of your fingers, will send data to the FBI, NSA, CIA and other US intelligence agencies.Africa Corps

description: The Emergency Hospital's maxillofacial surgery department underwent renovation, resulting in the country's only adult maxillofacial surgery department. The renovation cost approximately 9.2 million lei, covering repairs, furniture, and equipment installation.
original:
The renovation of the maxillofacial surgery department of the Emergency Hospital was completed. After the renovation work, the country's only department of maxillofacial surgery for adults was opened in the Emergency Hospital. The cost of the work amounted to about 9.2 million lei. Of this amount, about 6.2 million lei were allocated for repairs, about 880 thousand lei for equipping with furniture and about 2.1 million lei for the installation of an orthopantomograph, writes moldpres.md.

The department with 32 beds operates around the clock and specializes in providing medical care to patients with various maxillofacial pathologies: inflammatory processes, benign tumors of the soft tissues of the face, severe injuries, congenital malformations, as well as post-traumatic, postoperative consequences.

In 2021-2023 About 4,700 patients were treated in the department.t.me/aifmd

description: Crews of T-80BV tanks from the 155th Guards Marine Brigade of the Pacific Fleet are undergoing intensive training at the coastal fleet forces' training grounds in Primorye. Experienced officers, who participated in combat operations, are conducting classes, focusing on armored vehicle usage in the North Military District zone. Training includes firing from tanks and combat vehicles, using targets simulating anti-tank crews, mobile light armored vehicles, and enemy strongholds.
original:
Forwarded from: Pacific Fleet
The crews of the T-80BV tanks of the 155th Guards Marine Brigade of the Pacific Fleet are undergoing intensive training at the training grounds of the coastal fleet forces in Primorye. Classes for military personnel are conducted by officers who participated in combat operations, taking into account the experience of using armored vehicles in the North Military District zone.

In a special area for firing from tanks and combat vehicles, an environment similar in terms of conditions to a real battle is created. The targets used are targets simulating small-sized firing points of anti-tank crews, mobile light armored vehicles, as well as enemy strongholds. Training is carried out both during the day and at night.

In addition, crews are trained to fire from closed firing positions, during which tanks are used as artillery pieces. This technique allows you to hit targets at much greater distances than direct fire.

Particular attention during training is paid to vehicle maneuverability, camouflage, target reconnaissance speed and shooting adjustments.⚓️t.me/TOF_VMF

description: The Russian Navy, Chinese Navy, and Iranian Navy began the international naval exercise 'Maritime Security Belt-2024' in the Gulf of Oman. The exercise aims to ensure the safety of maritime economic activities and involves over 20 ships, support vessels, and combat boats from the three countries. Participants will practice joint maneuvering, firing at surface and air targets, and freeing a ship captured by pirates.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
🇷🇺🇨🇳🇮🇷Ships of the Russian Navy, Chinese and Iranian Navy began to carry out the tasks of the international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt-2024” in the Gulf of Oman. A detachment of warships of the Pacific Fleet consisting of the guards missile cruiser “Varyag” and the frigate “Marshal Shaposhnikov” "has begun to practice the practical tasks of the joint international naval exercise "Maritime Security Belt-2024" with ships of the Iranian and Chinese navies. The exercise is taking place in the waters of the Gulf of Oman in the Arabian Sea. Its main goal is to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities. During the exercise, combat ships of the three countries will perform joint maneuvering and fire at surface and air targets, and will also practice elements of freeing a ship captured by pirates.

In total, more than 20 ships, support vessels and combat boats of the Russian Navy, the Iranian and Chinese Navy are involved in the exercise. Naval helicopters are also widely used.

The international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt 2024” is being held for the sixth time. It was first held in the Arabian Sea in 2018. Ships of the Russian Navy, Iranian and Chinese Navy are participating in the exercise on an ongoing basis. Last year, the frigate Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Gorshkov, the world’s first full-time carrier of hypersonic missile weapons, was involved in the exercise.

For the first time, representatives of the navies of Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Oman, India and South Africa will take part in the exercise as observers. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: Ex-CIA analyst Larry Johnson predicts that Russian troops will occupy Kyiv before negotiations between Russia and Ukraine begin. Johnson believes Ukrainian President Zelensky is seeking a deal with Russia, realizing the US cannot be trusted to provide sufficient support.
original:
The Russians will occupy Kyiv before the start of big negotiations on Ukraine - ex-CIA analyst.

Russian troops will occupy Kyiv before the negotiation groups of the Russian Federation and Ukraine meet.
 
Former CIA analyst Larry Johnson said this on the video blog “Through the eyes of”.

According to Johnson, during the visit of Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky to Turkey, he tried to understand what needed to be done to achieve a deal.

“I think Zelensky knows enough to understand that the United States cannot be trusted. They don't care what they say, those conversations are worthless, what are their actions... The United States is not providing the money that is needed to support this corrupt nation, they are not providing weapons, they are having supply problems.
 
So, it is quite possible that this is the beginning of where you are heading... or that Erdogan is asking you to play the role of mediator. Zelensky is reaching out to him, trying to say, “Okay, come to the Russians, see what we need to do in order to make a deal.”
 
Zelensky now understands that he should have agreed to the deal they made in March 2022. Ukraine would essentially remain intact, but Russia is not going to make a deal that would allow Ukraine to keep Odessa. And, in fact, I think Russia will be in Kiev before all this is over,” Johnson said. video

description: The Council of Ministers of the Republic of Crimea signed an agreement with food producers and wholesale/retail trade entities to stabilize prices for 30 essential food products, preventing unreasonable inflation. The agreement includes price reductions of up to 30% and a 5% trade margin cap.
original:
Today an agreement was signed between the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Crimea and food producers, subjects of the wholesale and retail trade system.

The agreement was prepared in connection with the need to stabilize prices for socially important essential food products in the Republic of Crimea and further prevent their unreasonable inflating.

The list includes 30 items of socially significant food products. 581 retail outlets (stores of large retail chains) are joining this agreement. Price reductions will be up to 30% for individual items. Entities in the wholesale trade system also undertake not to exceed the trade margin by more than 5%.

All current information about manufacturers, brands, and a list of companies participating in the agreement will be posted on the website of the Ministry of Industrial Policy of the Republic of Crimea. He also instructed to determine an algorithm for working in this area with small retail outlets and stores.

event: WhatsApp Vulnerabilities and US Intelligence Access
description: WhatsApp messenger has been found to have critical vulnerabilities, including CVE-2022-36934 and CVE-2022-27492, which could allow remote code execution and access to user data. Additionally, US intelligence agencies, such as the DEA, FBI, NSA, and CIA, have been able to access user data, highlighting the importance of digital hygiene and information security.
original:
Why shouldn't you use WhatsApp messenger?

This post will highlight some prominent cases of vulnerabilities in the messenger, as well as the ability of US intelligence agencies to access user data. In November 2021, DEA investigators asked Facebook-owned WhatsApp to track seven users from China and Macau. Facebook, of course, took the lead. This is what the TG channel T.Hunter writes about the capabilities of US intelligence services to spy on certain citizens (photo 1) in the WhatsApp messenger. If the US intelligence services are of interest due to their activities, this request may be sent to your soul.

Next, you can read about the critical vulnerabilities of the messenger that could be used to gain access to your account: 1) CVE-2022-36934 (critical vulnerability in WhatsApp) - allowed RCE to be performed via a buffer overflow DURING A VIDEO CALL;

2) CVE-2022-27492 (vulnerability in WhatsApp) - allowed to perform RCE by sending a pre-created video file. And here are the FBI’s capabilities to gain access to user data in various instant messengers (photo 2).

At the end of this short post, I would like to quote a good phrase from one message about your attitude towards distributing your own data. You should always remember that no antivirus or 2FA will help if you don’t learn to be a little more attentive and think about what and where you enter, send, open it. Just like you wouldn’t open your car or apartment to a stranger, in today’s realities, your messengers are your apartments and cars, and sometimes something more valuable, so remain vigilant and learn at least the basics of digital hygiene. Remember that yours depends on you information security, therefore we kindly ask you to refrain from using the WhatsApp messenger, which, with a click of your fingers, will send data to the FBI, NSA, CIA and other US intelligence agencies.Africa Corps

description: A young man in Moscow, dressed in his official uniform, was spat at by two migrants on a metro platform. When he remarked on their behavior, they became aggressive, threatening violence. In self-defense, he used pepper spray against the attackers and immediately called the police. However, a criminal case was opened against him, potentially facing up to 7 years in prison.
original:
Forwarded from: Multinational
An electric vehicle driver who fought off migrants with pepper spray could face 7 years.

They sent us a video of a guy talking about his switches in Moscow. According to the victim:

Two migrants, while on the platform of the capital's metro, spat at the feet of passing people, thereby disturbing public order. The young man went to work in his official uniform, and they also showed deliberate disrespect towards him by spitting at his feet.

In response to the remark made to the migrants, the foreigners also began to show aggression. Acting deliberately, they began to threaten with violence, one began to throw fists, the other tried to hold him. After another push to the shoulder with a fist, pepper spray was used in the direction of the attackers.

The young man, knowing full well how conflicts with migrants sometimes end, did not want to risk adding to the list of obituaries, having received a sneaky stab. Next was an immediate call to the police.

However, a criminal case was opened not against the migrants, but against the victim who used a spray can towards the attackers. The case was initiated under Art. 213 part 2 (imprisonment for up to 7 years).

Unfortunately, this video was not sent to us by the victim himself and we do not have his contacts, so we cannot confidently say whether it is fake or not and in general how real the situation itself is. If someone has his contacts, then let him write to us, if everything is as he describes, we will provide legal assistance.

description: TikTok sent a notification to users, urging them to call US Congress members to vote against a law banning the app. However, lawmakers reported receiving thousands of calls from confused users, which only strengthened their resolve to pass the law.
original:
📱TikTok attacks and ... loses?❗️The office of the US Congress is "inundated with calls" from TikTok users regarding legislation to ban the popular application, reports the BBC.

Republicans and Democrats spoke of thousands of calls from a variety of people: teenagers, adult women, elderly people with a request not to ban TikTok. "They are confused and calling because 'TikTok told me to do it,'" the Republican Party said.

TikTok confirmed to the BBC that it sent out a notification to users calling on congressmen to urge them to vote against the law.🤷🏻But TikTok's massive mobilization appears to be backfiring.🗣️Lawmakers say TikTok and ByteDance's lobbying campaign only strengthened their resolve to pass the law .

The bill requires ByteDance to sell TikTok within six months, or TikTok will be removed from mobile app stores in the US. 🗳️The law is to be voted on on Wednesday.DM

description: A false claim about a one-time payment of 14,000 hryvnias to Ukrainians who have not traveled abroad since the full-scale invasion is being spread on TikTok. The Center for Countering Disinformation at the National Security Council has debunked the claim, stating that no such law has been passed in Ukraine.
original: ❌In tiktok they are spreading a fake about payments for citizens of Grodno, generated by AI 🔺 In tiktok they are spreading videos in which the hosts of Ukrainian TV channels allegedly report that the government has adopted Law No. 3386, according to which Ukrainians who have never traveled abroad since the beginning of the full-scale invasion are assigned a one-time payment in the amount of 14 thousand hryvnias. In fact, these videos are fake, explained the Center for countering disinformation at the National Security Council. Ukraine did not pass a law that would be registered as No. 3386. In addition, laws are adopted by people's deputies by voting in the Verkhovna Rada, and then they must be signed by the president. The government can propose draft laws, but does not pass them. 📌In the names of accounts from which fake videos are distributed, brands of well-known Ukrainian media are often used. Also, with the help of artificial intelligence, the voices of TV presenters are faked.DM

Nikolai is a base jumper with little experience but huge ambitions. Recently he decided to jump from one of the Moscow City towers. The jump itself was a success, but after that questions arose from the security forces.

The guy was very surprised when he was detained by employees of the Center for Countering Extremism. description: The all-Russian project #MUSICTOGETHER presented a new version of the famous song 'We need one Victory', performed by residents of Donbass and Novorossiya. original:
The all-Russian project #MUSICTOGETHER presented a new version of the famous song “We need one Victory” performed by residents of Donbass and Novorossiya. Birds don’t sing here,
 Trees don't grow
 And only we are shoulder to shoulder
 We are growing into the ground here. The famous lines and motive of Bulat Okudzhava touch the soul of anyone who is familiar with the events of the Great Patriotic War. The song he wrote for the film “Belorussky Station” had such power and energy that after its appearance on the screens the film instantly went to the people.

The composition was created after the end of the war, but those who performed it - people who survived the war - were able to convey in it to the new generation their incredible fortitude and will to win. The same as is now being demonstrated by residents of new Russian regions and all those who oppose nationalism and fascism.

Donetsk, Lugansk, Mariupol, Energodar, Gorlovka, Melitopol, Makeevka - residents of new Russian cities united to sing this Victory anthem together. event: Mobilized Man Detained and Threatened with Front Deployment
description: A mobilized man, recovering from a serious leg wound, was detained in a military unit and threatened with deployment to the front despite his medical condition. His phone was confiscated, and he was promised to be sent on the first flight to the front. The man's brother reported the incident to the military prosecutor's office, and eventually, the military prosecutor's office intervened, releasing the man.
original:
We achieved the Military Military Commissariat! The brother of a mobilized man wrote to us, who, instead of being sent to the Military Military Military Command with a serious leg wound, was locked in a military unit, his phone was taken away and he was promised to be sent on the first flight to the front: Hello. I do not know what to do. On February 20, my brother was hospitalized with aggravated wounds in his leg. At the hospital he was operated on the same day and treated for a week. They removed the fragments and discharged me yesterday, February 26, giving the necessary documents and certificates. They prescribed detailed treatment and release from service until March 6th.

Today he came to the military hospital, where he was examined and a referral was written to the Military Military Commission in his unit. He arrived at the unit, where the chief of medicine was. The service major (surname unknown) did not even look at his leg, ordered him to be locked in the weapons room and sent to the North Military District on the nearest side.

While my brother had the phone, he told me everything. Then one of his colleagues wrote to me that he was locked up and his phone was confiscated. I called the unit, the assistant on duty at the unit accepted my request that a complaint had been written to the military prosecutor's office regarding the obstruction of treatment and illegal restriction of freedom.

They began to assure me that everything was completely wrong, but they promised that my brother would write to me soon. Several hours have already passed. My brother literally has holes in his leg. The doctor said that the treatment would take at least two months. But that's what happens

I have all the certificates from the hospital, photos, videos of his bandages, wounds, etc. The conversation with the assistant duty officer was recorded.

Their military ID cards were confiscated. They went to each base without documents. Now there are no identification documents either. Secondly, military ID records contain only personal data. Neither the unit, nor the commander, nor anything. Empty. There is no contract in hand. It's complete trash. We are doing everything to ensure that people do not return to the front after hospitalization; we are also weakening the Russian army in this way. They recommended writing a complaint to the military prosecutor's office. And here is the result: They released me. VVK is taking place. People from the military prosecutor's office arrived at the unit and released my brother. Write for help in “Go through the forest”

At the pier, the submariners were also met by the command of the Submarine Forces of the Pacific Fleet, Navy veterans, officers of the headquarters of the submarine formation, the administration of the Vilyuchinsky urban district, relatives and friends.

description: Russian troops are advancing in almost all directions, occupying new positions and building defensive structures on the Belgorod borders. The troops require assistance in building and equipping positions, dugouts, trenches, and field ammunition depots.
original:
Forwarded from: Charitable Foundation "RUSSIAN ORDER"
Friends!

I want to say that the guys at the front really appreciate our efforts.

Now OURS are advancing in almost all directions and occupying new positions. New defensive structures are being built on the Belgorod borders and existing ones are being strengthened. Knowing our neighbors is important and necessary. I propose to postpone the collection of things, food and other things. We now need to help our soldiers build and equip positions, dugouts, trenches, field ammunition depots, etc. I am attaching 2 lists that arrived today, March 10, 2024. The previous lists from the guys are similar. You also always need a chain-link mesh to protect against FPV drones, metal (sheets, corners, profiles), edged and unedged boards, logs, OSB panels, plywood, etc. You need a lot of building materials and tools.

I ask everyone who has the opportunity to purchase anything from the lists for the guys.

To understand what we already have and what is still missing, leave the names from your orders in the comments.

Among other things, you should know that the doors of the Russian order are always open to volunteers and caring people. We will be happy to meet you and show you how the Foundation works. We can organize training on weaving camouflage nets in workshops #people_netBelgorod, we can show how cargo is received and formed for our sponsored units. We can teach you how to pour trench candles and make a dry shower. As before, you can send parcels through the OZON and Wildberries marketplaces to the addresses of delivery points: Belgorod, st. Makarenko 32 Send codes to receive in private messages to our volunteer Olga@BaksheevaO With respect and gratitude,
Margarita Sazonova.

Andreev also highlighted Warsaw's official denial of Polish military personnel in Ukraine, while acknowledging the presence of 'Polish volunteers'.

Therefore, of course, there are no guarantees that this or that position will not be revised later,” the diplomat clarified. Andreev added that Warsaw officially denies the presence of Polish military personnel in Ukraine, but admits the presence of some “Polish volunteers” there. Subscribe on IZ.RU

event: First Flight of P-4 Training Aircraft
description: On March 12, 1917, the P-4 training aircraft, designed by 25-year-old engineer A. Porokhovshchikov, took its first flight in revolutionary Petrograd. The aircraft was unique in that it could be easily converted between front-engine and rear-engine versions, catering to different pilot training needs.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Aviation🇷🇺
Exactly 107 years ago, on March 12, 1917, in revolutionary Petrograd, the P-4 training aircraft, developed by 25-year-old engineer A. Porokhovshchikov, took off for the first time.

This plane is interesting primarily because it was designed in two versions at once: with a front engine and with a rear engine. At the same time, the fuselage nacelle with the power plant could be changed during operation, easily turning the front-engine version into a rear-engine one and back.

The front-engine modification was intended for training in flying conventional aircraft, and the rear-engine modification was intended for those who were to fly airplanes with pusher propellers - "Farmans" and "Voisins". At that time, the majority of Russian corps and army air squads flew these machines, so the “rear-engine” was considered a higher priority and it was the first to be built.

Serial production was hindered by the civil war and the resulting collapse of the aircraft industry. Aircraft production in Russia fell sharply, and no training aircraft were built at all for two years. But in 1920, they remembered the project and made a second version, this time with a front engine, which received the designation P-4bis.

Porokhovshchikov's aircraft were operated in flight schools until 1923.#DAY OF HISTORYRUSSIAN AVIATION

description: Soldier Serhiy Deineko, nicknamed Zubnik, died on July 20, 2023, in the area of the village of Stepove, Zaporizhzhia region, due to enemy mortar fire while executing a combat mission. He was a rifleman of the 2nd separate rifle battalion of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
original:
​​💔Soldier Serhiy Deineko, nicknamed Zubnik, died on July 20, 2023 in the area of ​​the village of Stepove, Zaporizhzhia region. During the execution of a combat mission, he was mortally wounded as a result of enemy mortar fire. The defender would have turned 40 in September.

Serhiy was born and lived in Kamin-Kashirskyi, Volyn region. After finishing the 9th grade, he entered the VPU and received an education as a painter, bricklayer, and plasterer. Then he graduated from the Rokytniv medical school and became a dentist. He spent all his student years on stage, because during his school years he studied at an art school and had a good voice. Teachers and students affectionately called him "our Soloveyko".

After graduation, he started a career in the acquired profession in the outpatient clinic of the village of Velikiy Obzyr. Colleagues and patients remembered him as a responsible, sensitive, accessible and always smiling specialist. He was able to find an approach to everyone. Later, he continued his work in the village of Huta Borovenska, where he gained considerable honor and respect. In his spare time he liked to collect mushrooms and fish. If possible, he went to the forest and could walk for hours in search of mushrooms, or in the company of best friends and friends spend time near water bodies waiting for the peck.

During the full-scale war, the man joined the ranks of the defenders. He was a rifleman of the 2nd separate rifle battalion of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. At first he was in the guard company, and in December 2022 he went to the front. Together with his brothers, he defended the Zaporizhzhia region.

"After dad's sudden death, Serhiy became a support for mom, as they lived together. He was always smiling, positive, sincere, generous, never refused a request to help. He took responsibility for his work, because he loved what he was doing. He was especially awe-inspiring to my children, because he didn't have any of his own. Even when he was at zero, at the slightest opportunity he tried to communicate with them via video link. These were warm conversations about the day, school, friends, hobbies, cats - he wanted to know about everything that was happening in their lives , while he himself kept the defense thousands of kilometers away. He had the same conversations with all of us, on the other hand, he did not tell us anything about his difficult moments, he tried to protect us from unnecessary worries. He believed that after the victory he would create his own family. We all believed it, but not was tried," said the sister of the deceased.

Serhii was buried on the Alley of Glory of the central cemetery in his hometown. At home, his mother Galina Ivanovna, sister Valentina, relatives and friends were waiting for him. Ukrainian Truth together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of fallen soldiers

description: Defense Express analyzed why Western tanks, such as the Leopard 2, Abrams, and Challenger 2, did not become the main force in the Ukrainian counteroffensive. The conclusion is that they were not designed for assault anti-personnel missions, unlike Soviet tanks. Western tanks were originally designed for defense, as seen in the development of the MBT-70, which was meant to stop Soviet tank invasions.
original: The Ukrainian military portal Defense Express analyzed why Western tanks did not become the main violin of the Ukrainian counteroffensive, despite all their advantages over Soviet ones. The short conclusion is quite simple: they were not designed for assault anti-personnel missions. “Despite the idea that the tank is an all-purpose vehicle combining strong armor, firepower and mobility, this statement is not very true when it comes to Western tanks such as the Leopard 2 , Abrams or Challenger 2. Because they are quite far from the concept of “universal soldiers”, “assault vehicles” and other epithets. And this quite distinguishes them from tanks created in the USSR.” The authors of the review “return to the roots” of Western tank building - the legendary MBT-70, developed as a response to the Soviet T-64. And the task of the MBT-70 was precisely “to stop the Soviet tank invasion”, to be a defense tank. Living proof of this is the fact that for the 120-mm smoothbore gun of the successor to the MBT-70 - the Leopard 2 tank - Rheinmetall did not provide a high-explosive fragmentation projectile at all: “Among the tasks of this tank there was no task to fight targets for which it would be such a projectile is needed.” Read more here. @yigal_levin

event: US House of Representatives Attempts to Bypass Regulations for Ukraine Aid Bill
description: Democrats in the US House of Representatives are using a rare parliamentary tactic to bypass Speaker Mike Johnson's opposition to a bill on aid to Ukraine. They aim to collect 218 signatures on a discharge petition, allowing the bill to be brought directly to the floor for debate.
original:
Democrats in the US House of Representatives are trying to bypass regulations for the sake of a bill on aid to Ukraine. The US House of Representatives will try to introduce a bill on the allocation of aid to Ukraine, bypassing Speaker Mike Johnson.

The bill passed the Democratic-run Senate last month but failed to advance to the House.

The speaker's persistence in opposing the legislation prompted Democrats to resort to a rare parliamentary tactic.

House Democratic leaders told rank-and-file lawmakers they would begin accepting signatures on a so-called “discharge petition.”

It will allow the bill to be brought directly to the floor for debate, provided they can collect 218 signatures - a majority of the seats in the House.

Congressmen have resorted to this method only a few times in the entire history of the United States.

Johnson himself is trying to prevent attempts by congressmen to submit a Senate bill for consideration bypassing the regulations. @anna_news

description: The PPO (Presidential Protection Office) is continuing to demolish residential high-rise buildings in Krivoy Rog. As a result, people are being evacuated from the area.
original: Krivoy Rog. PPO continues to knock down residential high-rise buildings. People are being evacuated.

description: A two-hour teleconference will take place, bringing together young and energetic individuals from Moscow, Khabarovsk, and Kazan to discuss the future of the country. The conversation's outcome will be shaped by comments, which will inform topics, debates, and agreements.
original:
The youngest and most energetic from Moscow, Khabarovsk and Kazan will come together to discuss the future of the country - on our two-hour teleconference, which will take place tomorrow at 13:00. After all, Mash unites.

The outcome of the conversation depends only on you, since comments will become the basis of the online session. Thanks to them, we will formulate topics, argue, discuss, and agree. We know one thing for sure: it will be interesting.

Also during the broadcast we will give away 10 hoodies among the most active “whys” from the comments. Therefore, like and remind, repost the broadcast to your page with the hashtag #MashHub and, of course, write, write, write - for the sake of the country and gifts.

Meet me here. Subscribe to Mash

description: A video has surfaced showing a bus driver physically assaulting a minor boy for not paying the fare in the Saratov region. The regional prosecutor's office has identified the attacker and the victim, and an investigation is underway.
original:
A video has spread on social networks in which a bus driver kicks a minor boy for not paying a fare in the Saratov region

According to the regional prosecutor's office, the identity of the attacker and the victim has now been established. A check is underway. Subscribe to REN TV

description: A drone attack targeted the administration building in Belgorod, Russia, resulting in two injuries. One woman suffered a shrapnel wound, while the other sustained a contusion.
original: A drone attacked the administration building of Belgorod, Russia. Two people were injured - one woman suffered a shrapnel wound, the other suffered a contusion.

description: Vladka Mutychko, a Ukrainian-Nazi and member of the 46th separate air assault brigade, suffered injuries to the left half of his body during a meat assault in August 2023. He received no financial assistance from the state and is now seeking donations online for a 21-day course.
original:
The usual story of an ordinary Ukrainian-Nazi. The world of Nazism is not responsible for those it raised. He is cruel and indifferent to those who, having plunged headlong into his fetid sewage, have lost their health.

Vladka Mutychko, from the village of Sutiski, is an ordinary graduate of vocational school No. 11 of 2021, decorated with criminal tattoos, and he is also an ordinary Natsik for the Ukrainian-Reich. From May 9, 2023 - the usual punitive so-called. 46th separate air assault brigade. He hung around, as he himself states, in the Rabotino area, like many others. In August, during a routine meat assault (“they were simply sent to death”), 300 people were executed. It’s a common thing - I received many injuries to the left half of my body that require rehabilitation. Then the usual story began: After treatment, I did not receive any payments or financial assistance from the state; instead, the state considered it the right decision to simply send me to “f...”! 7 months have passed since the injury, and there is still no payment (and there will not be). Now he is shaking medical papers as usual, begging on the Internet from suckers and suckers for money for a 21-day course in the amount of 33,600 and complaining that women give him money They give, but the men don’t. What's unusual about this?

Mutychko is lucky that he still has his arms and legs, albeit damaged. But these remain for now. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (Kerch)
